prompts.name: risk_management
examples: What are the bigget risks in my portfolio
prompts.instructions: Classify a request as risk_management if the user asks about the performance or risks in their portfolio

prompts.name: fundamental_data
examples: What will AAPL's IPhone Sales be?
What was Netflix's historical subscription multiple to earnings?
What was General Motors EPS for Q3 2021
prompts.instructions: Classify a request as research_and_modeling when a user requests fundamental data about a stock

prompts.name: performance_history
examples: What is my year to date PNL (profit and loss)?
What are my biggest loses and biggest winners?
prompts.instructions: Classify a request as research_and_modeling when a user requests about historical performance of their portfolio

prompts.name: corporate_access
examples: When is the next corporate access event for Morgan Stanley?
prompts.instructions: Classify a request as corprate_access if they ask about meetings or events with a corporate

prompts.name: earnings_date
examples: When is the next earnings date for Mcdonalds?
What was the time series of earnings dates for IBM?
prompts.instructions: Classify a request as earnings_date if the user asks about a corporate earnings date

prompts.name: data_access
examples: What data do we have on TSLA?
What credit card data do we have?
Do we have data on health care claims?
prompts.instructions: Classify a request as data_access when a user asks what data is available?

prompts.name: macro
examples: What were the historical inflation, gdp, and employment numbers for the US?
prompts.instructions: Classify a request as macro if the request is about macro economic data bout a country or region

prompts.name: other
examples: What is the best way to get to the office?
prompts.instructions: Classify a request as other if it is not one of the above categories
